intro: Santiria puberula, commonly known as the hairy santiria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small yellow flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, elongated fruits. Santiria puberula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
